citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
An approximately one year old black dappled female boer goat was housed with a brown boer goat near two other black
dairy type goats. The black dappled boer was in distress compared to the other non-panting goats. The black dappled
boer goat was open mouthed panting with a snotty nose, and sneezing. The licensee was unaware of the black dappled
boer goat's condition and she was not under treatment.
Daily observations of the animals should be routinely made in order to ensure potential health issues are promptly
communicated to the attending veterinarian so that appropriate treatment can be provided as deemed necessary.
This is a 2nd Re-License Inspection for a Class “C” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 1 more inspection or by July 27, 2023, or the applicant will forfeit the license fee
and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(3)  Direct Repeat
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
An approximately one year old black dappled female boer goat was housed with a brown boer goat near two other black 
dairy type goats. The black dappled boer was in distress compared to the other non-panting goats. The black dappled 
boer goat was open mouthed panting with a snotty nose, and sneezing. The licensee was unaware of the black dappled 
boer goat's condition and she was not under treatment. 
 
Daily observations of the animals should be routinely made in order to ensure potential health issues are promptly 
communicated to the attending veterinarian so that appropriate treatment can be provided as deemed necessary. 
 
This is a 2nd Re-License Inspection for a Class “C” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the 
applicant. 
 
All items must be in compliance within 1 more inspection or by July 27, 2023, or the applicant will forfeit the license fee 
and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection. 
 
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires. 
 
 n

species.common: DOMESTIC PIG / POTBELLY PIG / MICRO PIG
